definition: chief executive of Special Administrative Region (Hong Kong or Macao)/abbr. for 特別行政區首席執行官|特别行政区首席执行官
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc

sentences.english: He has made the best use of his position as acting chief executive to talk to people on the street.
sentences.chinese: 他好好地利用了署理特首的身份，和普羅市民溝通。

sentences.english: Dr. Peter Lee receives the award from Mrs. Selina Tsang.
sentences.chinese: 李仲賢博士接受特首夫人頒授獎狀。

sentences.english: The chief executive is pre-ordained by the central government.
sentences.chinese: 特首是由中央政府欽點。

sentences.english: The Chief Secretary was an ideal candidate to be the territory's next Chief Executive.
sentences.chinese: 政務司司長是下任特首的理想人選。

sentences.english: At 8pm last night， Mr Leung formally submitted his resignation to the chief executive.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚八時，梁錦松正式向特首請辭。

sentences.english: Chief Executive Tung Chee-hwa was yesterday appointed as a delegate to the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference.
sentences.chinese: 特首董建華昨日獲委任爲全國政協的港區委員。

sentences.english: Mr Tung disclosed that Mrs Ip had submitted her resignation on June 25.
sentences.chinese: 董特首透露葉局長早於六月二十五日已向他請辭。

sentences.english: Only one in every five people believe Tung Chee-hwa should run for a second term as Chief Executive.
sentences.chinese: 只有五分一人希望董建華連任特首。

sentences.english: Why are we using different wordings to measure the support rates of CE and the principal officials?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼特首和問責官員的支持率採用不同提問方式？

sentences.english: How satisfied are you with Chief Executive's policy in relieving people's hardships?
sentences.chinese: 你滿唔滿意特首發表有關舒解民困既政策呢？

sentences.english: Donald Tsang, HKSAR's chief executive, forwent his car this morning and walked to work.
sentences.chinese: 香港特首曾蔭權今天早上帶頭棄車步行上班。

sentences.english: ' Do you think what he said could help alleviate people's dissatisfaction?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲特首呢番說話可唔可以平復巿民既不滿情緒？

sentences.english: Premier Wen Jiaobao was said to be angered by Chief Executive Tung Chee-hwa for underestimating the number of protestors at the July 1 march.
sentences.chinese: 總理溫家寶對董特首低估七一遊行人數感到非常憤怒。

sentences.english: I have decided not to take part in the by-election of the chief executive in July.
sentences.chinese: 我決定不參與七月的特首補選。

sentences.english: Both Mr Tsang and Mr Tang are tipped as forerunners in the race for the next chief executive.
sentences.chinese: 曾蔭權和唐英年都被視爲下屆特首的熱門人選。

sentences.english: Why, at this moment, has the central government accepted the resignation of Mr Tung Chee-hwa? What are your expectations of the Acting Chief Executive Mr Donald Tsang?
sentences.chinese: 你對代理特首曾蔭權有什麼期望？

definition: Leung Chun-ying (1954-), 3rd Chief Executive of Hong Kong
Carrie Lam (1957-), chief executive of Hong Kong 2017-, full name 林鄭月娥|林郑月娥[Lin2 Zheng4 Yue4 e2] Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor
Sir Donald Tsang or Tsang Yam-Kuen (1944-)
governor of Hong Kong (during the period of British rule, 1841-1997)
abbr. for 民主建港協進聯盟|民主建港协进联盟, Democratic alliance for the betterment of Hong Kong (DAB), Hong Kong pro-Beijing party
Tung Chee-hwa (1937-), Hong Kong entrepreneur and politician, chief executive 1997-2005

Liaison Office of the Central People's Government in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (abbr. for 中央人民政府駐香港特別行政區聯絡辦公室|中央人民政府驻香港特别行政区联络办公室[Zhong1 yang1 Ren2 min2 Zheng4 fu3 Zhu4 Xiang1 gang3 Te4 bie2 Xing2 zheng4 qu1 Lian2 luo4 Ban4 gong1 shi4]) or the equivalent office in Macao
Tung Chee-hwa (1937-), Hong Kong entrepreneur and politician, chief executive 1997-2005
